title: Carl Icahn Boosts Occidental Stake to Almost 10%
summary: Billionaire shareholder activist has criticized $38 billion acquisition of Anadarko. Carl Icahn has doubled down on a fight to take control of Occidental Petroleum Corp. , buying up more shares of the embattled oil-and-gas producer in recent days as its stock price plummets.

title: After Containment Fails, Italy's Neighbors Shift to Epidemic Management
summary: Slowing down spread of virus is key to allowing health-care systems to cope. Western nations have shifted their focus from trying to contain the novel coronavirus to slowing the speed of its transmission, but are struggling to calibrate their response, with the health imperative clashing with fears about the economic costs of shutting down activity across wide swaths of the developed world.

title: The Virus and Leadership
summary: Trump's main opponent isn't Joe Biden. It's the coronavirus.. When President Trump sees a political threat, his instinct is to deny, double down and hit back. That has often been politically effective, but in the case of the novel coronavirus it has undermined his ability to lead.

title: Pain and Suffering for Profit
summary: Where there's a coronavirus patient, there's a trial lawyer.. Hardly a business doesn't expect to be harmed by the coronavirus pandemic, but you had to know that trial lawyers would find a way to turn a buck from all the pain and suffering. Sure enough, a Florida law firm is now seeking to shake down Princess Cruise Lines for causing emotional distress to passengers recently quarantined off the coast of California.

title: HHS Secretary Is Largely Sidelined in U.S. Effort to Battle Coronavirus
summary: Alex Azar's role in fighting epidemic wanes; supporters say he is being unfairly scapegoated. Health and Human Services Secretary Alex Azar appeared taken aback late last month when lawmakers questioned whether someone else should lead the nation's response to coronavirus.

title: Some Fed Banks Shift Staff to Work From Home to Guard Against Coronavirus Risks
summary: The shift is part of a broader trend to help limit the spread of illness. Some of the Federal Reserve's 12 regional banks begun encouraging staff to work away from their respective banks Wednesday when possible in response to the rapidly moving threat of the novel coronavirus.

title: The Democrats Self-Quarantine
summary: Everyone is looking for safe havens. For Democrats, that means Joe Biden.. The Democratic presidential primary race is effectively over. Bernie Sanders can't win. The rate of turnout in primaries among the millennial socialists who are his base does not match turnout among Joe Biden's voters, most notably black Democrats. These realities won't change for Mr. Sanders. Indeed, they will worsen, and for one reason-the coronavirus.

title: Dodd-Frank Worsens Covid's Risk
summary: The Fed, FDIC and Treasury need the same powers they wielded against the 2008 crisis.. Coronavirus is contagious. So is financial panic.

title: U.S. Banks Can Weather Market Turmoil, CEOs Tell Trump
summary: At White House meeting, bank leaders strike a calming tone. We're here to help. This isn't a crisis. The economy is strong.

title: Biden Can't Lose, at Least Until November
summary: Sanders is down and probably out, but will all his supporters unite behind his rival?. Bernie Sanders badly needed to win the Michigan primary. It was 2016, and he'd lost eight of 12 Super Tuesday contests to Hillary Clinton and split delegates almost equally in the four contests the following weekend.

title: Biden Was Right to Back the Iraq War
summary: 'Disqualified'? He should defend his 2002 vote with pride.. 'My friends are dead because of your policies," a man shouted at Joe Biden the other day. "You are disqualified, sir." He was referring to Mr. Biden's October 2002 vote for the Iraq war. But Mr. Biden should be proud of that vote.

title: 'The Lost Family' Review: Search and Surprise
summary: A lot of people are taking advantage of DNA testing and other ways of tracing their origins. They're not always prepared for what they ﬁnd.. The stories keep coming. You, or perhaps a sibling, spouse or friend, take a DNA test expecting to fill out missing branches on the family tree, learn about a far-flung relation, or discover a distant connection to royalty or celebrity. Instead, the results deliver utterly unimagined surprises. The past comes rushing in and jostles settled assumptions and understandings.

title: Coronavirus Infections Reach Government Ranks
summary: Politicians tend to be older and not disposed to 'social distancing,' making them prone to falling ill- as many have. The novel coronavirus has begun to infect political leaders world-wide, hampering their ability to operate in a time of crisis and showing how even the highest echelons of government aren't beyond the disease's reach.

title: Paid Sick Leave Is a Failed Cure
summary: Washington state already has a mandate. Contrary to Sen. Murray, it hasn't helped arrest coronavirus.. Democrats in Congress have a cure for the coronavirus crisis: a nationwide paid sick-leave mandate. Sen. Patty Murray of Washington says this new benefit would allow people to "focus on staying healthy and preventing the spread of this disease." Her House sponsor, Rep. Rosa DeLauro of Connecticut, said the lack of such a mandate could "make coronavirus harder to contain."

title: Notable & Quotable: Higher Education
summary: 'The Department of Feminist Studies at the University of California, Santa Barbara, invites applications for a tenure-track position at the rank of assistant professor in queer migrations.'. From a January job posting at a public university:

title: University of Michigan Fires Chief Academic Officer Following Misconduct Allegations
summary: Martin Philbert had been on administrative leave from his post as provost; 20 women have filed complaints. The University of Michigan removed its chief academic officer Wednesday following accusations of sexual misconduct.

title: Boeing Acts to Preserve Cash
summary: Coronavirus adds to pressure from delays in getting MAX recertified. Boeing Co. took steps to preserve cash as the coronavirus pandemic and delays in the recertification of its 737 MAX aircraft exact a mounting toll on the aerospace giant.

title: Broadway Usher Tests Positive for Coronavirus
summary: Performances continue at theaters where employee worked as venues address concerns with deep cleanings. A part-time Broadway employee who has been working on two prominent shows has tested positive for the novel coronavirus, two theater owners said Wednesday.

title: New York's Coronavirus Containment Zone 'Blown Out of Proportion,' Some Residents Say
summary: Gov. Andrew Cuomo calls his New Rochelle move crucial to reduce high-density gatherings in a state with more than 200 confirmed cases so far. Teenagers missed sports practice.

title: Saudis Plan to Increase Oil Production Capacity
summary: Some OPEC nations try to broker oil-market peace, others grow resentful of cartel leader, Saudi Arabia. Saudi Arabia on Wednesday unveiled plans to boost its oil-production capacity to help fight a price war with Russia, as other producers launched attempts to mediate a truce.

title: House Passes War Powers Resolution Limiting President's Ability to Strike Iran
summary: Bill passed Senate in February, in response to U.S. killing of Iran's Gen. Qassem Soleimani. WASHINGTON-The House of Representatives passed a resolution that would limit the president's ability to take military action against Iran without approval from Congress.

title: New Enterprise Associates Amasses $3.6 Billion for 17th Fund
summary: Largest vehicle yet for the more than 42-year-old technology, health-care venture firm. New Enterprise Associates has raised $3.6 billion for its 17th venture fund, the largest in the more than 42-year history of the firm.

title: New Playground in Manhattan's Battery Will Be Climate-Change Resilient
summary: Many of the playground's features will be built above the floodplain. The conservancy that oversees The Battery in lower Manhattan will break ground on one of the largest climate-change-resilient playgrounds in New York City on Thursday.

title: Congress Approves Bill to Kill DeVos Plan on Student-Debt Forgiveness
summary: President Trump hasn't said whether he would sign the bill. WASHINGTON-Congress passed a bill that would kill a Trump administration plan to reduce Americans' ability to have their student loans canceled in cases of alleged college fraud.

title: IT Spending Forecasts Hit by Coronavirus
summary: 'Downside risk is increasing every day,' says IDC spending report. Companies are expected to pull back on information-technology spending amid growing uncertainties over the impact of the coronavirus pandemic on global markets.

title: Xandr Chief Executive Brian Lesser Resigns
summary: Lesser was founding CEO of Xandr, AT&T's unit that uses data to sell targeted ads. Brian Lesser, the chief executive of AT&T Inc.'s advertising technology unit Xandr, is leaving in a move that caught some within the company off-guard, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: House Passes Revised Surveillance Law as Deadline Nears
summary: Factions within both parties oppose the bill to renew a cornerstone of national-security system that expires this weekend. WASHINGTON-The House voted to renew domestic spying tools that expire in four days, overcoming opposition from an array of factions within both parties, in an attempt to wrap up legislative business before leaving town later this week as fears mount over the spread of the novel coronavirus.

title: Best Buy's Executive Chairman Won't Stand for Re-Election
summary: J. Patrick Doyle, lead independent director, to take over as chairman. Best Buy Co. Executive Chairman Hubert Joly won't stand for re-election in June, a year after relinquishing the chief executive role, the company said Wednesday.

title: Appeals Court Reviews Ohio Law Restricting Down-Syndrome Abortions
summary: Antiabortion activists see hope that the conservative bench could uphold protection of fetuses with the genetic disorder. A federal appeals-court case heard Wednesday in Ohio could help shape a contentious question in abortion law: Should a woman be allowed to terminate a pregnancy because of the fetus's disability, race or gender?

title: Sanders Vows to Stay in Race, as Biden Looks to Unite Democrats
summary: Two powerful liberal groups declare former vice president the likely party nominee. Bernie Sanders made a case for continuing in the 2020 race, challenging his front-running rival, Joe Biden, to embrace a series of liberal causes, as the former vice president sought to unite the Democratic Party behind his presidential bid.

title: What Happened When One Student Got Coronavirus on a Trip to Barcelona
summary: Vanderbilt cancels classes after the student tracked down classmates to warn them, stayed away from his mother. Max Schulman felt a bit off as he boarded a flight Saturday morning from Barcelona to New York's John F. Kennedy International Airport, but figured he was worn out after an eight-day spring-break trip to the Spanish city to visit college friends.

title: Swedbank Notifies U.S. of Potential Sanctions Violations
summary: The bank said an internal investigation found $4.8 million in transactions that constitute potential sanctions violations. Swedbank AB said Wednesday that it has notified the U.S. Treasury Department's Office of Foreign Assets Control of potential sanctions violations regarding $4.8 million of transactions following an internal probe.

title: U.S. Upbraids China Over Human Rights
summary: Pompeo, issuing human rights report, repeats that China's treatment of Muslims represents the 'stain of the century'. WASHINGTON-Secretary of State Mike Pompeo singled out China's treatment of religious minorities as one of the world's worst examples of abuse as he presented the State Department's annual report on human rights on Wednesday.

title: Amazon Expands Coronavirus Sick-Leave Policy
summary: Paid leave will be available for warehouse staff and other hourly employees affected by the pandemic. Amazon . com Inc. is offering paid sick leave to all workers-including part-time warehouse staff-who are affected by the spreading novel coronavirus, as companies scramble to minimize the economic hardship of the pandemic on their employees.

title: Tax-Filing Delay Would Cushion Taxpayers, Create New Challenges for Preparers
summary: Trump administration likely to delay April 15 tax-filing deadline, though details haven't been announced. WASHINGTON-Tax professionals' frenzied period before the April 15 tax deadline will likely be stretched over a longer time frame, offering a cash cushion to some taxpayers and easing the need for face-to-face contacts that could spread the novel coronavirus.

title: The 30 Minutes That Can Make or Break the Trading Day
summary: Late-day moves in the stock market have been a staple, creating swoons-and surges-right before the closing bell. Sharp stock moves are punctuating the final minutes of the trading day, exacerbating what has already been one of the rockiest stretches of the past decade for financial markets.

title: Modell's Files for Bankruptcy, Plans to Close Down All Stores
summary: The sporting-good retailer, a fixture in greater New York, plans to shutter its stores after failing to secure an investor. Modell's Sporting Goods Inc. filed for bankruptcy on Wednesday and said it plans to shutter all its stores, a stark outcome even considering the challenges facing today's bricks-and-mortar retailers.

title: Coronavirus Throws U.S. Sports Into Chaos
summary: New edicts from local officials force organizers to bar spectators at the men's and women's basketball tournaments; the NBA will suspend its season. The NBA abruptly suspended its season Wednesday night after a player tested positive for the coronavirus and the NCAA said that March Madness will be played with no fans on an extraordinary day of upheaval in American sports.

title: Treasury Yields Climb to Cap Day of Wild Swings
summary: Midday jump coincides with auction of benchmark 10-year notes. U.S. government bond yields rose Wednesday to cap a day of wild swings, whipsawed by an auction of 10-year notes, concerns about liquidity and investors' fears about economic damage from the spread of the coronavirus.

title: Online Travel's Unknown Destination
summary: A warning from Booking.com's parent casts more doubt on the sector's outlook. Online travel stocks are in uncharted waters. They will likely stay there for a while.

title: To Your Health: The Doctors Vs. Prosecutors
summary: We would be better off with the cheating attorneys in jail and the cheating doctors in the poorhouse.. Regarding Kyle Clark and Andrew George's "A Court Corrects a Medical Injustice" (op-ed, March 7): Attorneys find a way to change an objective measurement into an opinion. An opinion becomes a disagreement in judgment. The disagreement is attributed to bias and a man is exonerated.

title: Socking the Rich on NQDC Hits Many Others
summary: In addition to building savings, nonqualified deferred compensation gives employees a vested interest in their organization's long-term success and is critical in recruiting and retaining talent.. Nonqualified deferred compensation (NQDC) plans are used by businesses of all sizes and benefit employees at all levels, not just those at the top ("Proposal Targets Executive Tax Break," U.S. News, Feb. 28). Recent data indicate that 69% of NQDC participants have accumulated less than $100,000 in their plans. In addition to building savings, NQDC gives employees a vested interest in their organization's long-term success and is critical in recruiting and retaining talent, which is particularly important in today's highly competitive labor market.

title: For Business, Does Biden Mean Four More Years of Obama?
summary: The former vice president is a pro-worker candidate who criticizes stock buybacks, but at heart he's a pragmatist friendly to business interests.. Editor's note: This is an excerpt from our newsletter, "2020 Election+Business," a weekly dive into the intersection of business, finance and the 2020 election. You can sign up here.

title: Biden Unlikely to Bring Back Bipartisanship
summary: Vice President Biden learned from the best-his White House boss-when it comes to reaching across the aisle.. Regarding William A. Galston's "Joe Biden Gets Back in the Ring" (Politics & Ideas, March 4): Mr. Galston longs for bipartisanship in Washington and former Vice President Joe Biden argues that it is still possible. Whether or not that is true, Mr. Galston believes that Joe Biden will "act as though it is and by so doing increase the possibility of its restoration." Does that suggest that if President Trump acts like he desires bipartisanship, Democrats in Congress will look for common ground and stop acting like he is an illegitimate leader?

title: Thalidomide Is a Legal, Useful Drug for Some Cases
summary: Thalidomide was ultimately approved by the FDA in 1998 for the treatment of erythema nodosum leprosum.. In his review of "The Invention of Surgery" by David Schneider, John J. Ross points out an error, but makes one of his own (Books, March 7). In saying that thalidomide was flagged by the FDA in the early 1960s due to the "heroic skepticism of the lead reviewer, Dr. Frances Kelsey," Mr. Ross states that thalidomide was never approved by the FDA. In fact, thalidomide was ultimately approved by the FDA in 1998 for the treatment of erythema nodosum leprosum, an inflammatory complication of leprosy.

title: New York Abandons Broken Windows, Bail Requirement
summary: On June 11, 1996 Mrs. Evelyn Alvarez was murdered. The attacker's fingerprints were found at the scene, and matched to an individual who had been arrested and fingerprinted several months before for turnstile jumping.. Regarding your editorial "The 'No Bail' Fiasco in New York" (March 7): On June 11, 1996, Evelyn Alvarez, the owner of a dry-cleaning establishment on Manhattan's Upper East Side, was murdered as she was opening her shop. The attacker's fingerprints were found at the scene and matched to an individual who had been arrested and fingerprinted several months before for turnstile jumping.

title: The British Are Coming-to Your Streaming Menu
summary: With mainstream and niche services ramping up offerings of classic U.K. fare, fans must solve the mystery of what and how to watch. When Millie Robinson visited England as a teen in the 1970s she was exposed to a world of British television that had yet to make it to PBS programming at home. For years after, she had a hard time getting her hands on many of the low-key murder mysteries and quirky comedies from the U.K.

title: Did Pelosi and Schumer Learn Anything from Impeachment?
summary: The leadership message in a new Gallup poll.. Remember that time House Democrats impeached the President without accusing him of any crime? Voters do, and a new Gallup poll suggests they weren't impressed. One lesson is that Mr. Trump's congressional adversaries may want to resist the urge to seek political advantage from every twist and turn in the coronavirus saga. Voters are bound to remember that, too.

title: Fed Again Upsizes How Much Money It Will Lend Wall Street
summary: Central bank's expanded repo operations are designed to mitigate the risk of money-market pressures. For the second time this week, the Federal Reserve Bank of New York increased the amount of temporary liquidity it was willing to provide to Wall Street's biggest banks, while also expanding how long banks can tap some of its funding.

title: U.S. Treasury Blacklists Two Zimbabwean Officials for Alleged Human Rights Abuses
summary: The designations followed the blacklisting of the two officials by the U.S. State Department for alleged human rights violations last year. The U.S. blacklisted two Zimbabwean officials for alleged human rights violations, the U.S. Treasury Department said.

title: Saudi Arabia's Crown Prince Tanked Oil Markets. Here's the Back Story.
summary: Mohammed bin Salman, one of the most powerful men in the Middle East, chose a weekend when the world was preoccupied with the novel coronavirus to assert his standing at home and abroad. In just 24 hours, Saudi Arabia's crown prince launched an oil-price war with Russia and sidelined a domestic rival to cement his power at home. But his surprise actions on the world stage and within his own kingdom were set in motion months ago.

title: 'Where the Truth Lies: The Art of Qiu Ying' Review: Copying the Masters to Become One
summary: The first exhibition outside Asia devoted to a 16th-century Chinese painter recognized as one of the Four Great Masters of the Ming dynasty and long considered something of an enigma..

title: Big Michigan Turnout a Boost for Biden-and a Warning for Trump
summary: State's Democrats flocked to the polls, specifically to back Biden; if they do the same in November, Trump may struggle for a repeat victory. Nearly 380,000 more people voted in Michigan this year than in the state's 2016 Democratic primary, a 30% increase. And yet Sen. Bernie Sanders, in all-but-complete results, wound up with fewer votes than last time. Former Vice President Joe Biden, alone, benefited from the surge.

title: Airlines Urge Travelers to Give Flying a Chance
summary: Carriers are trying to bolster sagging sales by touting plane cleanings, low fares. Airlines are doing everything they can to get people to fly.

title: New York's Public Universities Move Classes Online Over Coronavirus Concerns
summary: Move affects State University of New York, City University of New York systems. ALBANY, N.Y.-The state and city universities of New York will shift to a distance-learning model for the remainder of the semester in response to the coronavirus, Gov. Andrew Cuomo announced Wednesday.

title: New York to Boost Coronavirus Testing
summary: State to contract with private labs; 'We're not in a position to rely on the CDC or the FDA'. New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo on Wednesday said the state will begin contracting with private labs to greatly increase the number of people tested for the novel coronavirus.

title: Bernie Sanders Faces Tough Contests Ahead, Including Florida Primary
summary: Vermont senator's path relies on wins or strong performances in states he lost in 2016 bid. BURLINGTON, Vt.-Bernie Sanders's hopes of securing the Democratic presidential nomination rely on an unlikely path that would require him to top or tie Joe Biden in states he lost in his 2016 bid, a tough proposition as his momentum in the race wanes.

title: Hedge Fund Solus Shutting Flagship Fund, Citing Coronavirus Turmoil
summary: Firm suspends withdrawals, saying turbulence caused by the pandemic has made it difficult to raise cash to fulfill those requests by selling holdings. Hedge-fund manager Solus Alternative Asset Management LP, known for its investment in retail chain Toys "R" Us, told investors this week that it is shutting its flagship fund and will restrict redemptions as it works to sell off holdings, according to a letter viewed by The Wall Street Journal.

title: 'Of Love and Rage' Review: Star-Crossed Lovers, Eye-Crossed Audience
summary: Alexei Ratmansky's sprawling new work about a thwarted romance is filled with busy, hard-to-follow action..

title: Workers Take Stock of Sick Time, Wondering if It Would Be Enough
summary: Some big employers are adjusting their policies. But millions question whether their sick days will run out.. Millions of American workers have no paid sick time, and millions more who do are wondering if they will have enough to cover a severe illness. While some of the country's biggest companies are adjusting their policies because of the coronavirus, there are still many employees who worry that falling ill will leave them in a precarious financial position.

title: Bloomberg Campaign Spent $275 Million on Anti-Trump Ads
summary: Advisers to ex-New York mayor, who dropped out of Democratic race last week, says he will spend whatever it takes to unseat president. WASHINGTON-Michael Bloomberg's presidential campaign spent $275 million just on advertising attacking President Trump, according the campaign.

title: Digital Ad Upfronts Weigh Going Online-Only Amid Coronavirus Fears
summary: YouTube will stream its annual pitch to advertisers instead of hosting an in-person event. This year's Digital Content NewFronts were supposed to be a big party for streaming video. Now, its organizer is advising presenters to make their pitches to advertisers online-only as the media and marketing industries grapple with the novel coronavirus outbreak.

title: How to Build a Better Athlete
summary: From performance genes to 3D-printed tissues, a look at some emerging innovations in sports medicine.. Author

title: Supreme Court Allows Enforcement of Remain-in-Mexico Policy
summary: High court allows administration to maintain policy during ongoing litigation. WASHINGTON-The Supreme Court allowed the Trump administration to continue enforcing an immigration policy requiring asylum seekers at the southern U.S. border to wait in Mexico while their cases are considered.

title: U.S. Budget Deficit Grew 15% in First Five Months of Fiscal Year
summary: The U.S. budget deficit totaled $625 billion in period as government revenue rose 7%. WASHINGTON-The U.S. budget deficit totaled $625 billion in the first five months of this fiscal year, a 15% increase over the same period in 2019, the U.S. Treasury reported Wednesday.

title: In the U.K., Brexit Stockpiles Become Coronavirus Stockpiles
summary: Some companies have found relief from disrupted supply chains in the inventories accumulated to deal with a different crisis. Britain's Brexit stockpiles are finally finding a purpose: filling supply-chain holes caused by the coronavirus.

title: Hollywood Relies More Than Ever on Streaming Revenue From Overseas
summary: China in 2020 was expected to unseat the U.S. as world's largest box-office market-until widespread theater closings due to coronavirus. More than ever, the fate of the movie business has become dependent on its prospects online and internationally.

title: Congress Can Take the Economic Edge off Covid-19
summary: Give cash assistance to low-income Americans so they don't feel compelled to go to work sick.. Covid-19 will soon be an epidemic in the U.S. Large cities need to take emergency measures to protect their residents, especially those who are at greatest risk for hospitalization or death. Congress has an important role to play in supporting states and cities.

title: Can Biden Win Over the Berners?
summary: He has to make a credible, verifiable show of respect and persuade them that he'll further their agenda.. Every Democrat wants to win in November. But getting progressives to show up for Joe Biden will be a heavy lift. This year has become a remarkably tight analogy to 2016, when enough Bernie Sanders supporters either boycotted the general election or voted for Donald Trump to deny Hillary Clinton her "inevitable" win. And "Bernie or bust" is as big as ever. A mere 53% of Sanders voters told Emerson pollsters they would definitely vote for the Democratic nominee, compared with 87% of Mr. Biden's backers and 90% of Elizabeth Warren's.

title: No Fans at Warriors Games as Health Officials Urge Sports to Take Action
summary: In the face of escalating pressure from U.S. public health officials and local governments, American sports leagues began taking steps to bar spectators. WASHINGTON-In the face of escalating pressure from U.S. public health officials and local governments, American sports leagues began taking steps to bar spectators to mitigate the risk of coronavirus transmission, the first of what could be the most severe disruptions to sports in more than a half-century.

title: MLB Wants Alternate Sites if Coronavirus Disrupts Season
summary: Teams could play at other stadiums in cities less affected by the crisis, or they could stay at their spring training facilities in Arizona or Florida. With opening day two weeks away, the Seattle Mariners said they are working with Major League Baseball Rob Manfred's office on "alternative plans" for their regular-season games this month. The move comes as baseball is searching for ways to play games at alternative sites, rather than in empty stadiums, as the pandemic spreads.

title: Disney Shareholders Approve Executive Compensation
summary: Shareholders endorse $47.5 million pay package for Executive Chairman Robert Iger. Walt Disney Co. shareholders approved a referendum outlining former Chief Executive Robert Iger's compensation for 2019, with less support than the previous year's vote.

title: Readers Binge On Books About Pandemics (Really)
summary: From Stephen King to Emily St. John Mandel, here are five books to help you lean into coronavirus fears. Social media is chattering about Stephen King's "The Stand," a novel revolving around a weaponized flu that kills almost all humans and animals on the planet. Although it came out in 1978, sales of the trade paperback were up 25% in the first eight weeks of 2020, while purchases of the hardcover more than tripled, according to NPD BookScan.

title: Economic Data to Watch for Signs of Coronavirus Impact
summary: So far, private-sector and government economic surveys have reflected conditions before concerns of the infection's potential economic impact rose. The impact of the novel coronavirus is rippling through U.S. and global economies, but it could take a few months to fully see the fallout in data that tracks economic performance around the world.

title: John Wood Group Earmarks $46 Million for Bribery Settlements
summary: The oil-field services company said it could estimate the cost of expected settlements related to dealings with Unaoil. John Wood Group PLC has reserved $46 million to cover costs associated with possible settlements with U.S., Brazilian and Scottish authorities, the oil-field services company said.

title: U.K. to Issue Most Debt in Eight Years to Bolster Economy
summary: The government plans to sell more bonds in 2020 than it has since 2012 as it seeks to boost its economy amid the coronavirus epidemic. The U.K. aims to raise more funds from selling government bonds this year than it has in eight years to fund its biggest spending plan since 1955 as the coronavirus epidemic weighs on growth.

title: Sugar Market Sours as Oil Slides, Virus Spreads
summary: The drop has caught traders expecting prices to rise on a sugar shortfall by surprise. The slide in oil prices and the spread of the coronavirus are causing collateral damage in the sugar market.

title: Stock Up for Coronavirus Without Getting Fleeced
summary: Panicked because the Purell's out? Remain calm, and heed these tips. Earlier this week, at the drugstore a block from my office, I came face-to-face with a new sign taped to the cash register: "Currently out of stock on masks and hand sanitizers, thank you." The woman behind the counter said staff was tired of repeating themselves. Online, I thought naively, I'll have better luck.

title: Rentals Gone Wrong
summary: Real-estate agents recollect rough experiences with leased properties. Tim Allen

title: Neiman Marcus Backs Away From Discount Business
summary: Retailer plans to close more than half of its Last Call stores to focus on luxury shoppers. Neiman Marcus Group Ltd. said it will close more than half of its Last Call discount locations to focus on its luxury department stores, retreating from an area that has been one of the few bright spots in retailing.

title: Why Dennis Quaid Bought a Smart Toilet
summary: The actor, musician and host of his forthcoming podcast 'Dennissance' on cutting the cord, catching up with the Queen and owning a robot that tends to very private needs. I started playing Sudoku in the paper about six years ago and now the Sudoku Joy app is the only game I play on my iPhone. Plugging in the numbers while in my trailer between takes is a good way to turn my brain off-to put a bookmark in what I'm doing and put work on hold.

title: Trump Administration to Delay April 15 Tax Deadline for Most Individuals
summary: Tax filing extension would be part of broader fiscal stimulus effort. The Trump administration plans to delay the April 15 tax deadline for most individual taxpayers as well as small businesses as part of an effort to mitigate the effects of the spread of the novel coronavirus, Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said Wednesday.

title: Strategic Partnership With China Lies at Root of Iran's Coronavirus Outbreak
summary: Pathogen spread rapidly from Qom, where Chinese-backed projects helped prop up nation's sanctions-hit economy. Iranian officials trace the origins of the country's coronavirus epidemic to the holy city of Qom, home to dozens of seminaries and religious shrines-but also a number of Chinese-backed infrastructure projects built by scores of workers and technicians from China.

title: Mnuchin Urges Congress to Pass Stimulus to Stem Virus Impact
summary: 'For small- and mediumsized businesses, we think it's appropriate for the government to pick up the costs,' Treasury secretary says. WASHINGTON-Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin urged lawmakers to quickly approve a stimulus measure to ease the economic pain inflicted by the novel coronavirus.

title: Prudential's Prudent Plan to Get Out of America
summary: The British insurer cautiously opted for a partial IPO of U.S. annuity business Jackson National rather than the spinoff favored by activist fund Third Point. Everyone agrees that venerable British life insurer Prudential needs to be broken up. The question is how and when.

title: Trump Endorses Tuberville Over Sessions in Alabama Race
summary: President backs former football coach over his first attorney general who held the seat for many years. WASHINGTON-President Trump endorsed former football coach Tommy Tuberville in the runoff to be the Republican nominee for the U.S. Senate in Alabama, throwing his influence behind the opponent of his former attorney general, Jeff Sessions, who is trying to win back his old seat.

title: A Dutch Couple Paid €1 For a Former School Gym and Turned It Into a Luxurious Home
summary: Flint van de Gronden and Linda van Dijk spent 18 months and roughly $565,000 transforming this outdated space into a two-story, 2,700-square-foot home in Rotterdam. In Rotterdam, the bustling harbor and second-largest city in the Netherlands, a couple traded in one unusual home for another when they decided to move from a very narrow row house to a former school gym. Part of a plan by the city to convert outdated school buildings into residences, the 2017 sale of the vast fixer-upper came with a price tag of exactly one euro.

title: Elbow Grease: Old Homes in Westchester, N.Y., with Good Price Tags
summary: These properties may need a bit of updating, but with possible payoff to the bottom line.. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: For These Young Homebuyers, Age Is Just a Number
summary: As older homes sit unsold, a small contingent of deal seekers are trading turn key for fixer-uppers. In December, when Amanda Barbarello and Erik Larson bought a beautiful, 105-year-old Arts & Crafts home in Dobbs Ferry, N.Y., they were thrilled by the deal they got: $799,000 for the four-bedroom, 2,400-square-foot house-almost $100,000 off its original listing price. The catch-it needed updating.

title: Saudi Bond Yields Climb Amid Oil-Price War
summary: Yields on dollar-denominated sovereign bonds rise after kingdom opens the spigot on crude output. Saudi Arabia's oil-market war with Russia prompted investors to demand higher yields on the kingdom's bonds this week, pointing to a possible financial stressor as tensions between the two energy exporters escalate.

title: South Korean Tanker Owner Heung-A Shipping Seeks Debt Restructuring
summary: Slowdown stemming from coronavirus hits troubled tanker operator that runs 19 ships. South Korean tanker owner Heung-A Shipping Co. is looking to restructure its debt as the coronavirus epidemic and slowing global trade continue to batter the shipping industry.

title: Too Much Tech Might Just Break Sports
summary: Data-driven playbooks and the rise of robot umpires risk taking the heart out of the game, says columnist Jason Gay. Author

title: Top Colleges by Size in the Northeast
summary: The region has more than half of the top 10 small schools nationwide in the WSJ/THE College Rankings. The Northeast is home to six of the top 10 small colleges in the country in the Wall Street Journal/Times Higher Education College Rankings.

title: Canadian Executive Set to Plead Guilty in College Admissions Scandal
summary: David Sidoo arranged for someone else to take SAT for his two sons using fake IDs, prosecutors say. A Canadian businessman is expected to plead guilty to fraud conspiracy after being accused of having someone else take the SAT on behalf of his two sons.

title: NFL, Players Nervously Await CBA Vote
summary: League owners already approved a new collective bargaining agreement. Now it's up to the players-and there are outspoken players who don't want it to pass. The day after the last year's NCAA basketball national championship in Minneapolis last April, NFL executives and union leaders covertly gathered in the same city to begin discussions of a new collective bargaining agreement. The owners wanted more games. The players wanted more money. They were nowhere near agreeing to anything.

title: What Happens When College Athletes Get Paid
summary: Several scenarios are in the works to let students make money off their sports, spelling big changes for schools, players and fans. Author

title: Airline Fees Rankle Travelers as Coronavirus Cancels Trips
summary: Passengers want refunds, but airlines and other travel companies are often offering more limited alternatives. Airlines and other travel companies are offering limited flexibility to travelers worried about coronavirus, and some restrictions still in force leave travelers paying what amount to virus fees.

title: Putin's Bid to Extend Rule Is Approved by Russia's Parliament
summary: Constitutional changes could make Putin the longest-ruling leader in Russia's modern history, surpassing Stalin. MOSCOW-Russia's parliament gave its final seal of approval to constitutional changes potentially allowing President Vladimir Putin to stay in power for years to come, removing a key source of uncertainty about Russia's political future and likely ensuring that Moscow will continue to challenge the U.S. on the world stage.

title: Coronavirus Hits Fiat Chrysler, Pirelli Plants in Italy
summary: Auto giant and tire maker to lower production as epidemic spreads. MILAN-Italy's coronavirus outbreak, the world's worst outside China, has started to hit the country's big manufacturers, with Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV and Pirelli SpA saying they will lower production as the epidemic advances.

title: Biden Picks Up Key Victory in Michigan Primary
summary: Michigan offers 125 delegates, the biggest prize of the night, while also being a key battleground state in November. Joe Biden triumphed in the key state of Michigan, while also winning in Missouri, Mississippi and Idaho, as he built his delegate lead over Bernie Sanders with a coalition of African-Americans, suburbanites and older voters in Tuesday's round of Democratic presidential nominating contests.

title: Miranda Kerr Puts Beauty Masks on Her Hands, Her Feet-and Even Her Husband
summary: The former Victoria's Secret Angel (and her husband, Snap Inc. CEO Evan Spiegel) swear by the same moisturizing face mask at night. A monthly column clocking people's nighttime rituals and product regimens.

title: PepsiCo Agrees to Buy Energy-Drink Maker
summary: Beverage giant to pay $3.85 billion for Rockstar. PepsiCo Inc. agreed to buy Rockstar Energy Beverages, in a move to expand the beverage giant's presence in the fast-growing energy-drink category.

title: The Top Takeaways From Tuesday's Election Contests
summary: Biden shows Michigan strength that could translate to November. Michigan, a state that breathed life into the Bernie Sanders presidential campaign four years ago, delivered a punishing blow to his 2020 prospects as Joe Biden easily won the most closely watched primary among Tuesday's six Democratic nominating contests.

title: Japan Olympics Chief Rejects Idea of Two-Year Delay Over Coronavirus
summary: 'We can't just stop the whole thing,' says former prime minister Yoshiro Mori. TOKYO-The head of Japan's Olympic organizing committee rejected the possibility of a long postponement of the Tokyo Summer Games, rebuffing a suggestion by a committee executive board member.

title: Plunging Mortgage Rates Might Not End U.S. Housing Doldrums
summary: Hangovers from financial crisis limit new construction and keep prices high, weighing on economy. With the average rate on a 30-year mortgage falling to 3.29% last week, financing a home purchase has never been cheaper. That could give the flagging economy a much-needed boost amid coronavirus fears.

title: AT&T's Xandr Ad Unit Cuts Deals With Disney and AMC
summary: Tools for data-driven advertising expand their reach.

title: Whether You're Tested for Coronavirus Depends on Where You Live
summary: While testing-equipment providers work to increase supplies, availability is uneven and some labs are limiting exams to the most severe cases. Coronavirus-test availability is ramping up in the U.S., but in a patchwork fashion that still isn't meeting demand, according to doctors, health-care administrators and state officials.

title: Coronavirus Is a Double Threat for Life Insurers
summary: The industry has to worry about the lives it insures as much as the bonds it owns. U.S. life insurers have taken it on the chin during the novel coronavirus epidemic, but investors may not be focused on one of the biggest threats they face.

title: Coronavirus-Closed Factories in China Face Delays in Restarting as Authorities Flip-Flop
summary: Authorities push back the restart date for most plants to the end of next week. Most factories in Hubei province won't be allowed to resume operations through March 20, the provincial government said Wednesday, dealing a delay to businesses in the region at the center of China's coronavirus epidemic struggling to return to normal.

title: Chinese-Owned TikTok Launches U.S. 'Transparency Center' to Counter Criticism
summary: Video-sharing app's Los Angeles facility to allow outside experts to view how teams at the company moderate content.

title: Hate Work Travel? That Could Be a Problem for Warren Buffett
summary: Berkshire Hathaway is betting U.S. airlines will overcome coronavirus, but some fear it could permanently reduce demand for corporate travel. Warren Buffett is betting that U.S. airlines' coronavirus woes are only a short-term downdraft. Others in the industry are fretting about a long-term danger: that companies ditch tedious work off-sites.

title: How to Stop Coronavirus Shutdowns Becoming a Crisis of Solvency
summary: Resume Subscription. As the impact of the coronavirus and the measures to prevent it keep spreading, governments around the world are grasping for ways to address the sudden seizure in economic activity.

title: West's Biggest Reservoir Back on the Rise, Thanks to Conservation, Snow
summary: Lake Mead, near Las Vegas, reaches its highest level in six years after successful efforts to slash water use.

title: Construction Industry Tackles Occupational Hazard: Suicide
summary: Firms aim to change a stoic culture and confront mental-health issues; 'I don't want to lose more employees'. Bayview Asphalt is a small paving company, employing about two dozen people. Over the past decade, the Seaside, Ore., business has lost two employees to suicide.

title: Amazon Battles Counterfeit Masks, $400 Hand Sanitizer
summary: Retailer struggles to address falsely labeled protective gear and price-gouging sellers, as anxious shoppers load up on supplies. As the coronavirus outbreak expanded across the globe, anxious shoppers turned to Amazon.com Inc. for face masks, hand sanitizer and other products promising to help protect against the virus.

title: 'Rent-a-Banks' Defy Efforts to Curb High-Cost Lending
summary: Lenders ink deals with banks to offer loans in states with interest-rate caps, spurring calls for tighter federal regulation. California this year sought to banish high-cost lenders. OppLoans was undeterred.

title: Making Luxury Goods Under Coronavirus Lockdown
summary: In Riviera del Brenta, heart of artisan leather and shoe production, masks and air filters. Italy's coronavirus lockdown has the global luxury-goods industry straining to keep factories open in the country while adopting precautionary measures to fight the spread of the disease in its ranks.

title: The Next Big Thing in Sports?
summary: These five forms of athletic competition are relatively niche, but their profiles are growing. Author

title: Ailing Chinese Bank Secures $1.7 Billion of New Capital
summary: Bank of Jinzhou, deep in bad loans, plans to sell new shares to two Beijing-backed buyers. BEIJING-State-backed investors will shore up Bank of Jinzhou Co. with an injection of roughly $1.7 billion in fresh funds.

title: U.S. Steps Up Coronavirus Fight
summary: New York sets up the country's first 'containment area,' colleges cancel classes and Biden, Sanders scrap rallies in Ohio. Across the U.S., efforts to contain the novel coronavirus escalated by the hour on Tuesday, as the number of confirmed cases topped 1,000. New York set up the country's first "containment area" around one of the largest clusters of cases in the U.S.; colleges told students not to return campus this spring; and the Democratic presidential candidates canceled rallies in Ohio.

title: Stop the Music: South by Southwest Coronavirus Cancellation Reverberates Through Economy
summary: The outbreak upends events across the globe. In Austin, the financial hit is 'kind of like a tornado'. AUSTIN, Texas-As South by Southwest approached, tech and cultural leaders from more than a hundred countries were preparing to flock to the festival this weekend to network, build buzz and down a few drinks.

title: How to Make a Can of Beans Exciting
summary: Whether canned, frozen, dried or fresh, beans get a glow up in this recipe for a bright and spicy salad with a creamy green goddess dressing. NOT EVERYONE brings the same gusto to a three-bean salad that Philip Krajeck does. The chef credits his upbringing in Brussels, where his father worked for NATO, with giving him a fresh perspective.

title: Twilight of the Sanders Revolution
summary: Biden gets closer to the nomination with a big victory in Michigan.. Democrats really, really want to defeat President Trump. That's the message from Joe Biden's primary victories on Tuesday as he further deflated the hopes of Bernie Sanders and his revolution.

title: Cleaning Up the FISA Mess
summary: The House GOP wins some modest reforms for accountability.. Inspector General Michael Horowitz in December exposed gross FBI abuse of a secret surveillance court in obtaining warrants to spy on former Trump aide Carter Page. House leaders late Tuesday struck a bipartisan deal to impose greater accountability, though in at least one respect it may make things worse.

title: U.S. Lacks Key Abilities to Avert Cyberattacks, Commission Says
summary: Report calls for drastic overhaul of the federal government to address cyber threats. WASHINGTON-The U.S. government needs to adopt structural changes not seen since the aftermath of the 2001 terrorist attacks to confront proliferating cyber threats that increasingly endanger national and economic security, a government commission has concluded.

title: Coronavirus Spreads to More Elder Facilities in Seattle Area
summary: Washington state governor issues new rules to limit nursing-home visitors. The disease caused by the novel coronavirus has turned up among residents or workers in at least 11 elder-care facilities in the Seattle area, and at least three have reported fatalities among residents, local health authorities said Tuesday.

title: Elon Musk Says Incentives, Costs Will Influence Site of New U.S. Tesla Factory
summary: Electric-car maker is scouting locations to build coming pickup truck and Model Y compact sport-utility vehicle. Tesla Inc.'s decision on where to build a new U.S. automobile assembly factory will be influenced by state incentives as well as access to a large workforce and low logistics costs, Chief Executive Elon Musk said.

title: Corporate-Bond Investors Shy Away From Risk
summary: On Monday, the extra yield that investors demand to hold U.S. corporate bonds over Treasurys increased by 0.3 percentage point. The additional returns that investors demand to hold corporate bonds are increasing as market volatility persists from coronavirus concerns and an oil-price war.

title: March 10 Primaries: Which States Are Voting and When Do Polls Close?
summary: Battleground state Michigan, and 5 other states, cast ballots, as Biden looks to solidify lead over Sanders. Voters in six states are casting primary ballots a week after former Vice President Joe Biden consolidated the moderate wing of the Democratic Party behind him and romped through South Carolina and the March 3 Super Tuesday states, surging past Sen. Bernie Sanders to become the front-runner.

title: Lawmakers Rebuff Trump on Payroll-Tax Suspension for Outbreak
summary: Some Republicans, Democrats seek targeted coronavirus relief; Mnuchin discusses possible package with Pelosi. WASHINGTON-President Trump's push to suspend the payroll tax to boost the economy during the coronavirus outbreak fell flat on Capitol Hill, as lawmakers of both parties said they preferred targeted measures to assist hourly workers and the battered travel industry.

title: Acting Intelligence Chief Skips Election-Security Briefing to Congress
summary: Richard Grenell didn't attend closed briefing Trump dismissed as 'another Russia, Russia, Russia meeting'. WASHINGTON-President Trump's acting intelligence chief, Richard Grenell, didn't appear before Congress on Tuesday for a closed briefing on election threats from foreign sources, as some Democrats expressed frustration about the administration's communication on election-security matters.
